# Introduction
Context of GR+DM vs apparent-gravity hypothesis; contributions of this work.

# Theory (Minimal)
- Two-layer split: isotropic GR-equivalent from (ρ★, ρ_gas) and an additional interface Σ term from iso-ω_cut surfaces.
- Angular kernel K(θ;χ) with Lambert default; forwardization β in appendix.
- Terminology: we refer to the ultra‑long electromagnetic mode as **ULM**, and distinguish a propagating branch (**ULM‑P**, ω>ω_cut) and a diffusive branch (**ULM‑D**, ω<ω_cut).
- Shared μ(k) with solar-system null μ0(k→∞)→1; restrained degrees of freedom (per-galaxy Υ★, a2).

# Early‑Universe FDB (Cosmic‑Dawn boost; Late‑FDB mainline)
We extend FDB beyond galaxy scales by introducing a spherical mini‑void boundary source that acts as a ULM‑P surface emitter in the early Universe. The resulting apparent gravity is shell‑theorem compliant: nearly zero inside the shell and ∝1/r² outside. To remain consistent with CMB/BAO, we adopt a Late‑turn‑on effective multiplier
\[\mu_\mathrm{late}(a,k) = 1 + \epsilon(a)\,S(k),\quad \epsilon(a)=\epsilon_{\max}\,\sigma\!\left(\frac{a-a_\mathrm{on}}{\Delta a}\right),\; S(k)=\frac{k^2}{k^2+k_c^2}.\]
We keep only three global degrees of freedom (\(\epsilon_{\max}, a_\mathrm{on}, k_c\)) and require that acoustic features are preserved (proxy‑scan shown below). As a fallback, an E‑FDB (CDM‑equivalent: \(w\simeq0, c_s^2\ll1\)) can replace CDM without adding net freedom.

Interpretation highlights:
- CMB/BAO 整合: Late‑turn‑onと BAO 帯での平均偏差の閾値管理により、音響列の保持を確保（プロキシ）。
- 成長ブースト: z≈30→6 で D′/D が数%–10% 程度でも、稀少尾 ν≳4 の指数感度により UVLF 明るい端は複数倍に増加し得る。
- 幾何起源: 球殻トイで外部 1/r²・内部 ~0 を数値検証。21 cm 境界強度 |∇Tb| と銀河の相関は、境界主導の形成を識別予測として示す。
